public final class Db
extends java.lang.Object

The database.

Field Detail

enable_log

public static boolean enable_log
Enables the log(...) method.

enable_delete_unused_columns

public boolean enable_delete_unused_columns
If true undeclared columns are deleted.

enable_drop_undeclared_indexes

public boolean enable_drop_undeclared_indexes
If true undeclared indexes are deleted.

enable_update_referring_tables

public boolean enable_update_referring_tables
Object delete triggers the updating of referring columns to null. Racing conditions may occur.

enable_cache

public boolean enable_cache
Objects retrieved from the database are cached. This ensures that get(...) returns the same instance of a previously retrieved object.

                         throws java.lang.Throwable
Called once to create the singleton instance.

java.lang.Throwable

instance

public static Db instance()
Returns:
instance created at initInstance().

initCurrentTransaction

public static DbTransaction initCurrentTransaction()
Initiates thread local for currentTransaction(). The transaction can be retrieved anywhere in the thread using Db.currentTransaction().

Returns:
the created transaction

currentTransaction

public static DbTransaction currentTransaction()
Returns:
current transaction that was initiated in the thread local by initCurrentTransaction().

deinitCurrentTransaction

public static void deinitCurrentTransaction()
Removes the transaction from the thread local and the JDBC connection is returned to the pool.

register

              throws java.lang.Throwable
Registers DbObject class to be persisted.

java.lang.Throwable

          throws java.lang.Throwable
Initiates the registered classes and connects to the database.

Parameters:
url - JDBC URL to the database
user -
password -
ncons - number of connections in the pool

java.lang.Throwable

                                         throws java.lang.Throwable

reset

public void reset()
Deletes and recreates all tables and indexes. Used by testing framework.

shutdown

public void shutdown()
Sets singleton instance to null and closes the connections in the pool.
